page.title: 08FORD AND WHARTON Cont.
page.content: River levels have obviously changed over the centuries. Wharton was once called{Wavertun (the town by the {water),}and when{Wharton Court}was built in{1604}it cannot have been customary for the river to flood. Today the cellars are unusable because of the flooding. There are three possibilities why the village at{Wharton was deserted: {disease, enclosure}when the Court was built, or a{change in the water level {in the river.}The inhabitants may have moved to{Newton}on higher ground to the South-West.
